abstract.p: Donna Karan holds party at flagship store on Madison Avenue for Candace Bushnell, author of New York Observer columns that formed basis of Sex and the City TV show, and her forthcoming book Four Blondes (S)

block.p: Fashion and movies. Fashion and music. Fashion and celebrities. These are classic pairings of the design world. But last week Donna Karan had a party at her Madison Avenue flagship store to mark a new marriage for sartorial savants: fashion and literature (well, sort of).

The featured author for the event was the ubiquitous Candace Bushnell, who wrote New York Observer columns that formed the basis of ''Sex and the City,'' the culturally seismic HBO show. Indeed, the star-flecked cocktail-and-shopping hour, to celebrate Ms. Bushnell's forthcoming book, ''Four Blondes,'' seemed like just the kind of event that Ms. Bushnell's clothes-savvy characters might attend.

The author tried to show the synergies between style and writing by wearing a garnet-colored leather-and-cashmere ensemble by Ms. Karan. The outfit matched the one-serving-size red glass bottles of Piper-Heidseick Champagne that guests sipped from straws.
